title: Inside Europe 27.10.2022
description: The UK gets its third Prime Minister in three months, Kazakhstan becomes a safe haven for companies fleeing sanctions, and France finds new use for its agricultural waste. Also: Ilya Matveev dares to imagine Russia without Putin, a double homicide spotlights homophobia in Slovakia, the Vatican has questions to answer, and Halloween comes to Germany.
itunes:author: DW.COM | Deutsche Welle
itunes:keywords: Europe, Adam Boulton, Ilya Matveev, Kazakhstan
